newsitem.title: USA: Nine companies bid for US Stockpile germanium.
newsitem.headline: Nine companies bid for US Stockpile germanium.

text.p: Nine companies, including producers, bid for germanium metal offered for the first time by the U.S. Stockpile.
The Stockpile was offering 4,000 kilos in the current fiscal year.
Lattice bid for 139 kilograms at prices ranging from $900 to $1,400 per kilo.
DRT International bid for 501 kilos at $100 per kilo.
Atomergic Chemetals bid for 1,000 kilos at $600 per kilo.
Eagle Picher Industries bid for 4,000 kilos at $1,251 per kilo.
Mistral Inc bid for 517 kilos at $1,100 to $1,300 a kilo.
American Xtel Tech bid for 4,000 kilos at $1,525 to $500 per kilo.
Laser Diode Inc bid for 2,000 kilos at $1,405 to $1,150 a kilo.
Metaleurop bid for 2,000 kilos at $980 to $800 a kilo.
GFI Advanced Tech bid for 100 kilos at $1,207 to $1,137 a kilo.
